issues.evidence: Readiness, ROI Signal, and Risk Posture cards all display a score of '0' in the result view.
issues.trust_impact: Displaying '0' across all metrics implies a broken calculation engine or a complete failure of the user's inputs. This destroys the credibility of the assessment tool immediately after the user invested effort to complete it.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Ensure the scoring logic returns meaningful non-zero integers or ranges. If '0' is a valid state, provide explicit context text explaining why the score is zero (e.g., 'Insufficient data').
issues.conversion_impact: Users are unlikely to convert or 'Talk to Sales' if the tool provides no value or appears to be malfunctioning.

issues.evidence: In the mobile header, there is a visual glitch underneath the search bar appearing as a second, empty rounded rectangle or shadow container.
issues.trust_impact: Obvious UI rendering defects in the navigation header suggest low code quality and lack of QA, which is damaging for a brand selling 'Enterprise' reliability.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Inspect the mobile CSS for the search component. Remove the extraneous container or pseudo-element causing the double-border effect.
issues.accessibility_impact: May cause confusion for screen readers if the artifact is a focusable element.
issues.conversion_impact: Visual sloppiness distracts from the primary conversion path.

issues.evidence: The 'Fast qualification form' at the bottom of the result page asks for 'Timeline', despite 'Timeline to Launch' already being collected in the initial assessment step.
issues.trust_impact: Asking for the same information twice makes the system appear unintelligent and disconnected, lowering user confidence in the platform's data handling.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Remove the 'Timeline' field from the qualification form and carry over the value from the initial assessment, or pre-fill it if editing is required.
issues.accessibility_impact: Unnecessary cognitive load and typing effort.
issues.conversion_impact: Every extra field reduces form completion rates; redundant fields are high-friction blockers.

issues.evidence: The 'Want a tailored rollout plan?' section presents three competing buttons: 'Request tailored plan', 'Book rollout session', and 'Review trust controls'.
issues.trust_impact: Cluttered calls-to-action dilute the hierarchy and suggest the platform is unsure of the optimal next step for the user.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Reduce to one primary CTA (e.g., 'Request tailored plan') and one secondary outline button. Move 'Review trust controls' to a text link or a separate 'Trust' section to reduce decision fatigue.
issues.accessibility_impact: increased navigation steps for keyboard users.
issues.conversion_impact: Choice paralysis can lower the click-through rate on the primary conversion goal.

issues.evidence: Badge text above the main headline reads 'HIGH-INTENT CONVERSION'.
issues.trust_impact: This appears to be internal marketing logic or a dev placeholder exposed to the user. It breaks the fourth wall, making the user feel like a metric rather than a customer, which significantly degrades trust.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Replace the text with a user-facing label such as 'Deployment Services' or 'Getting Started', or remove the badge entirely.
issues.conversion_impact: High. Users may feel manipulated or view the page as unfinished/robotic.

issues.evidence: A dark gray, rounded rectangle artifact is visible immediately below the search bar in the global header on both desktop and mobile views.
issues.trust_impact: The UI appears broken or glitchy, suggesting a lack of QA testing. For an enterprise tool, visual polish is a proxy for software reliability.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Inspect the header CSS/HTML. Remove the extraneous container or shadow element rendering below the search input.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium. Lowers perceived quality of the platform.

issues.evidence: Placeholder text in form fields (e.g., 'you@company.com', 'Company name') has very low contrast against the dark input background.
issues.trust_impact: Fails basic accessibility standards, alienating users with visual impairments and making the form appear disabled or inactive to some users.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Increase the lightness/opacity of the placeholder text color to meet WCAG AA contrast ratio standards (at least 4.5:1 for normal text).
issues.accessibility_impact: High. Hard to read for low-vision users.
issues.conversion_impact: High. If users cannot clearly see the fields, they are less likely to complete the form.

issues.evidence: The 'Preferred Start (UTC)' input displays raw browser default styling ('dd/mm/yyyy, --.--') which clashes with the custom dark theme.
issues.trust_impact: The interface looks inconsistent and unfinished. It relies on native browser controls that do not match the sophisticated aesthetic of the rest of the page.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Implement a custom date-time picker component that matches the design system, or apply CSS to style the native input to match the text inputs.
issues.accessibility_impact: Medium. Native controls are accessible but visually jarring.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium. Increases cognitive load to interpret the unstyled input.

issues.evidence: The form contains two competing buttons ('Request tailored plan' and 'Run readiness assessment') inside the form container. It is unclear if the second button submits the form or navigates away.
issues.trust_impact: Confusing UX signals a lack of clarity in the user journey, potentially frustrating enterprise users.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Make 'Request tailored plan' the sole primary submit button. Move 'Run readiness assessment' outside the form or style it as a clearly distinct secondary link/ghost button.
issues.accessibility_impact: Screen reader users may struggle to understand the context of two submit-like actions within one form region.
issues.conversion_impact: High. Users may hesitate to click, fearing the wrong action, or click the secondary button and lose their form data if it navigates away.

issues.evidence: Input placeholders (e.g., 'you@company.com') and field labels use dark grey text on a dark background, resulting in very low contrast.
issues.trust_impact: Low legibility feels unprofessional and excludes users with visual impairments.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Lighten the text color for labels and placeholders to ensure a minimum 4.5:1 contrast ratio against the dark background (WCAG AA).
issues.accessibility_impact: Severe. Users with low vision or poor monitors may be unable to read field labels or placeholders.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium. Difficulty reading fields increases cognitive load and friction during form completion.

issues.evidence: A visual artifact (ghost pill-shaped container) renders visibly beneath or misaligned with the search input field in the global header on both desktop and mobile.
issues.trust_impact: Visual bugs in the primary navigation signal a lack of QA and engineering polish, damaging the 'enterprise' feel.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Inspect header CSS to remove the extraneous background element or fix the flexbox alignment of the search container.
issues.conversion_impact: Low. Primarily a brand perception issue.

issues.evidence: Footer copyright displays '© 2026', which is a future date.
issues.trust_impact: Makes the site appear to be a template, AI-generated mockup, or neglected, significantly lowering credibility.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Update the copyright year to the current year dynamically.
issues.conversion_impact: Low. However, astute users may perceive the site as fake.

issues.evidence: In the 'Channels + Tools' section, the card labeled 'GitHub' features a red skull icon instead of the GitHub logo.
issues.trust_impact: Using a skull symbol (universally associated with death, danger, or malware) to represent a code repository integration is a catastrophic semiotic failure. It subconsciously signals that the integration is dangerous or malicious, directly undermining the page's core promise of 'Trust' and security.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Immediately replace the skull icon with the official GitHub 'Octocat' logo or a neutral code-branch icon.
issues.conversion_impact: Severe. Security-conscious enterprise buyers will likely bounce immediately upon seeing 'death' imagery associated with their code infrastructure.

issues.evidence: The 'Channels + Tools' section uses generic, non-branded icons for major enterprise platforms: Microsoft Teams (blue square), Slack (generic chat bubble), Jira (clipboard), and Entra ID (lock).
issues.trust_impact: Enterprise buyers expect official partner integrations. Using generic clip-art instead of official brand assets (SVGs) suggests these are not real, certified integrations, or that the product is 'vaporware' created from a low-quality template.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Replace all generic icons in the integration grid with the official, current brand logos for Microsoft Teams, Slack, Google Chat, Entra ID, SharePoint, and Jira.
issues.conversion_impact: High. Lack of official branding reduces credibility for an integration-heavy platform.

issues.evidence: In the top navigation bar, the 'Search playbooks' input field has a visible rendering glitch: a second, empty rounded border appears directly below the actual input field.
issues.trust_impact: Visual bugs in the primary navigation signal a lack of QA and attention to detail, which is concerning for a product claiming 'pixel-perfect' enterprise reliability.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Inspect the CSS for the search container. Remove the extraneous border or shadow on the container wrapper that is causing the double-input artifact.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium. Low polish correlates with low perceived software quality.

issues.evidence: In the mobile view, the 'Channels + Tools' section stacks 8 integration cards vertically in a single column, creating a very long scroll area with low information density.
issues.trust_impact: Low
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Change the mobile layout for the integration grid to a 2-column grid (2x4) or a horizontal swipe carousel to reduce vertical page length and improve scannability.
issues.accessibility_impact: Medium. Excessive scrolling increases physical effort.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium. Users may fatigue and drop off before reaching the bottom CTA.

issues.evidence: A visual artifact (misplaced grey container/border) appears directly beneath the search bar in the global header on both desktop and mobile views.
issues.trust_impact: High. Obvious UI rendering bugs in the primary navigation signal poor engineering quality and lack of QA, reducing user confidence in the platform.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Inspect the CSS for the search input container. Remove the extraneous background layer or correct the absolute positioning/z-index of the search field wrapper.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium

issues.evidence: Footer copyright text displays '© 2026 Claw Bureau'.
issues.trust_impact: Severe. A future-dated copyright year is a hallmark of AI-generated templates or fraudulent sites. It immediately destroys credibility for an enterprise security/compliance product.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Update the footer to display the current year dynamically using JavaScript (e.g., new Date().getFullYear()).
issues.conversion_impact: High

issues.evidence: On mobile, the search bar is horizontally compressed between the logo and hamburger menu, truncating the placeholder text and creating a cramped touch target.
issues.trust_impact: Medium. Suggests the mobile experience is an afterthought.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Replace the visible search input with a search icon that toggles a modal or expandable input field on mobile viewports.
issues.accessibility_impact: High. The small touch target and truncated text violate mobile usability best practices.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium

issues.evidence: The 'PRICING' label above the H1 uses a dark blue color against a black background.
issues.trust_impact: Low
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Lighten the text color to a shade that achieves at least a 4.5:1 contrast ratio against the black background (e.g., a lighter cyan or white).
issues.accessibility_impact: High. Fails WCAG contrast requirements, making it invisible to some users.
issues.conversion_impact: Low

issues.evidence: The 'Business' plan is visually highlighted with a border, but its CTA button ('Get Started') is identical in style and color to the lower-tier plans.
issues.trust_impact: Low
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Style the 'Business' plan CTA button differently (e.g., a solid white button or a distinct hover state) to reinforce it as the preferred/primary conversion path.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium

issues.evidence: A dark grey, rounded rectangular artifact is visible directly underneath the search input field in the global header on both desktop and mobile views.
issues.trust_impact: The interface appears broken or poorly implemented, which significantly undermines trust in the platform's technical quality.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Inspect the CSS for the search container. Remove the extraneous background element or correct the `height` and `overflow` properties to eliminate the double-bar rendering artifact.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium

issues.evidence: On mobile, the 'High-intent next steps' section (containing critical CTAs like 'Book rollout session') is buried beneath the extremely long 'Indexable families' list.
issues.trust_impact: Users may perceive the page as a passive directory rather than an actionable hub.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: On mobile breakpoints, reorder the layout to place 'High-intent next steps' above 'Indexable families', or wrap the 'Indexable families' list in a collapsed accordion by default.
issues.accessibility_impact: High navigation effort required for keyboard/screen reader users to reach primary action links.
issues.conversion_impact: High

issues.evidence: On desktop, the 'Indexable families' column is significantly longer than the 'High-intent next steps' column, creating a large area of trapped whitespace on the right side.
issues.trust_impact: The layout feels unpolished and unfinished.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Make the 'High-intent next steps' card sticky on scroll so it remains visible while reading the adjacent list, or redistribute content to balance column heights.
issues.conversion_impact: Low

issues.evidence: The 'Frequently cited pages' section presents a massive, unstructured wall of text links, making it difficult to scan for specific information.
issues.trust_impact: The page feels like a raw sitemap dump rather than a curated user experience.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Group these links into sub-categories (e.g., 'Agent Controls', 'Policies', 'Compliance') or implement a 'Show more' interaction pattern to reduce initial visual noise.
issues.accessibility_impact: Long, unstructured lists are tedious for screen reader users to navigate.
issues.conversion_impact: Medium

issues.evidence: In the global header (desktop and mobile), there is a visible, empty rounded-rectangle outline or artifact floating directly beneath the search input field.
issues.trust_impact: This obvious UI defect creates an impression of broken code or lack of QA, which is severely damaging for a company selling 'verification' and 'trust' infrastructure.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Inspect the header CSS/HTML to remove the duplicate container, shadow, or border element that is rendering incorrectly below the main search bar.
issues.conversion_impact: Distracts from the primary navigation and lowers perceived platform stability.

issues.evidence: The 'How it Works' ASCII/code diagram is simply scaled down on mobile devices, rendering the text microscopic and unreadable.
issues.trust_impact: Users cannot verify the technical 'proof' mechanism, which is the page's core value proposition. Hiding technical details due to poor responsiveness suggests a lack of transparency.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Replace the ASCII text block on mobile with a responsive SVG diagram, or implement a horizontal scroll container that maintains a legible font size (min 12px).
issues.accessibility_impact: Text size is well below readable standards, making the content inaccessible to all mobile users.
issues.conversion_impact: Blocks the technical buyer from understanding the product's differentiator, likely causing drop-off.

issues.evidence: The icons used in the 'Three Layers of Trust' cards (pencil, lock, clipboard) appear to be standard OS emojis rather than custom enterprise assets.
issues.trust_impact: Using generic emojis for high-stakes concepts like 'Execution Attestation' feels amateurish and low-budget, undermining the 'Enterprise' positioning.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Replace the emoji-style assets with a custom, monoline or high-fidelity icon set that matches the site's dark/technical aesthetic.
issues.conversion_impact: Reduces brand authority and perceived product maturity.

issues.evidence: The gray text within the code block diagram (e.g., flow arrows and comments) has very low contrast against the black background.
issues.trust_impact: Technical users may struggle to read the flow, leading to frustration and a perception that the technical details are obfuscated.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Increase the brightness of the gray text color in the syntax highlighter to ensure it meets WCAG AA contrast ratio (at least 4.5:1 against the background).
issues.accessibility_impact: Likely fails WCAG contrast requirements, excluding visually impaired users.
issues.conversion_impact: Impedes the 'technical win' by making the proof hard to read.

issues.evidence: The footer copyright year is hardcoded to '2026'.
issues.trust_impact: If the current year is not 2026, this looks like a template placeholder or an AI-hallucinated detail, suggesting the site is fake or neglected.
issues.exact_fix_recommendation: Dynamically render the current year using JavaScript or server-side logic.
issues.conversion_impact: Subtle erosion of credibility for detail-oriented users.
